description:
Lupin III: Castle of Cagliostro (a.k.a. Lupin the Third: The Castle of Cagliostro)

1979
Runtime:109 min
IMDB: <a href=" http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0079833" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0079833</a>
Audio: English, Japanese

Full Manga Entertainment Video DVD ISO rip with original DVD menues and anime previews. 

The first film directed by legendary Japanese animation director Hayao Miyazaki who&#039;s directed other films such as &#039;Howl&#039;s Moving Castle&#039;, &#039;Spirited Away&#039; and &#039;Princess Mononoke&#039;. I thought I would post this as the DVD doesn&#039;t seem widely available. I first got it from a library and later tried to rent it, but it took me a while to find it. I&#039;m not that familiar with Lupin the Third, but according to message boards, this is one of the better (if not the best) Lupin movies.

Plot Outline:
Reknowned international thief Lupin III (known as "Wolf" in the English dub) comes to the small European duchy of Cagliostro to investigate some excellently-forged money and stumbles across a national conspiracy going back some hundreds of years. Lupin and his friends must rescue the beautiful Clarice from the hands of the evil Count Cagliostro and solve the mystery of a hidden treasure dating back to the 15th century.
